> maven-surefire now also supports concurrent forks, and they don't have an=
y of the interaction problems you describe - as you know. Since surefire is=
 an > all-purpose runner, we try to support any "sensible" mode of executio=
n, and there are good use cases for both models of execution.

I was thinki=
ng about ANT actually, not maven (surefire). I admit we
also needed some ex=
tra control over suite allocation scheduling and
more detailed reporting, s=
o surefire wasn't a perfect fit for us. It
is a great tool though, I agree =
with that.

Dawid
